org.pcc.pams

Class SoundEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pcc.pams.SoundEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PhysicsListener 

    class SoundEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements PhysicsListener
    Generates all the sounds for the simulation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int DEFAULT_FUNDAMENTAL
      The default fundamental, which is C (Mi).
      private int fundamental
      The current fundamental in use.
      private boolean harmonic
      Whether or not harmonic sounds are being generated.
      private int[] harmonicChord
      The current harmonic chord associated with the fundamental.
      private static int MAX_VELOCITY
      The notes' max volume.
      private static int NOTE_LENGTH
      The standard note length, which is a half-note.
      private javax.sound.midi.Sequencer sequencer
      The sequencer used to order the sounds and produce a MIDI file.
      private javax.sound.midi.Synthesizer synthesizer
      The synthesizer used to generate the sounds.
      private static int TEMPO
      The resultant melody's tempo.
      private javax.sound.midi.Track track1
      The sequencer's first (and only) track.

      • sequencer

        private final javax.sound.midi.Sequencer sequencer
        The sequencer used to order the sounds and produce a MIDI file.

      • synthesizer

        private final javax.sound.midi.Synthesizer synthesizer
        The synthesizer used to generate the sounds.

      • track1

        private javax.sound.midi.Track track1
        The sequencer's first (and only) track.

      • harmonic

        private boolean harmonic
        Whether or not harmonic sounds are being generated.

        This is used to produce a more melodious recording, and can noticeably change the sound when there are many bubbles.

      • fundamental

        private int fundamental
        The current fundamental in use.

      • harmonicChord

        private int[] harmonicChord
        The current harmonic chord associated with the fundamental. Must be updated each time the fundamental changes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundEngine

        public SoundEngine()
            throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException,
                   javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Prepares the sound engine for first-time use.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException - Thrown if unable to initialize systems.
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Thrown if unable to create sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • createMajorChord

        private static int[] createMajorChord(int fundamental)
        Create a table containing only the notes from a perfect major chord.
        Parameters:
        fundamental - The note number of the fundamental to use.
        Returns:
        An array of note numbers representing the chord.

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Erases existing recorded data and re-initializes all systems.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Thrown if it fails to create sequence.

      • setHarmonic

        public void setHarmonic(boolean isHarmonic)
        Toggles the harmonic mode.

        When in harmonic mode, notes are taken from a pre-generated pool of values.

        Parameters:
        isHarmonic - True if harmonic, false otherwise.

      • setFundamental

        public void setFundamental(int newFundamental)
        Changes the value of the fundamental note.
        Parameters:
        newFundamental - The new value of the fundamental.

      • save

        public boolean save(java.io.File file)
        Saves record data to the specified file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to save the data to.
        Returns:
        True if file write successful, false otherwise.

      • bubbleToBubbleCollision

        public void bubbleToBubbleCollision(Bubble bubble,
                                    Bubble otherBubble)
        Called when a bubble collides into another bubble.
        Specified by:
        bubbleToBubbleCollision in interface PhysicsListener
        Parameters:
        bubble - The first colliding bubble.
        otherBubble - The second colliding bubble.

      • bubbleToWallCollision

        public void bubbleToWallCollision(Bubble bubble,
                                  Wall wall)
        Called when a bubble collides into a wall.

      • addNote

        private void addNote(javax.sound.midi.Track track,
                     int note,
                     long startTick,
                     long tickLength,
                     int velocity)
        Adds a new note to the track and plays it.
        Parameters:
        track - The track to add the note to.
        note - The note's value (from 0 to 127).
        startTick - The position on the track (in ticks) for the note.
        tickLength - The length of the note (in ticks).
        velocity - The volume of the note.
